meanings.definition: A young sheep, especially one that is one year old.
meanings.sent1: The farmer counted the hoggs in the field to make sure they were all accounted for.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd took care of the hoggs in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous hogg managed to escape the pen and playfully ran around the farm.
meanings.sent4: The flock of hoggs resembled fluffy clouds grazing on the green meadow.
meanings.sent5: The little hogg's bleating could be heard across the valley.

meanings.definition: A type of heavy boot worn by soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The soldier polished his hoggs before the parade.
meanings.sent2: The army issued new hoggs to the recruits for training.
meanings.sent3: The muddy battlefield made the soldier's hoggs look like they were part of the terrain.
meanings.sent4: The clunking sound of the hoggs echoed through the barracks.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out hoggs showed the signs of many long marches.

meanings.definition: To cut off the hocks of (a horse).
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith had to hogg the injured horse to prevent further pain.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian recommended hogging the horse to avoid complications.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy apprentice accidentally hogged the horse too short, much to the dismay of the owner.
meanings.sent4: The skilled farrier carefully hogged the horse, ensuring a clean cut.
meanings.sent5: The decision to hogg the horse was made to improve its quality of life.
